epd_metadata.owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_process_certifier_contact.name: Megan Blizzard
epd_process_certifier_contact.address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA

epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete for general construction including foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure, marine applications, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern (SVHC) exceeding 0.1% by weight
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required
data_quality.background_data_sources: Assessed as good or very good

NSW_ACT.energy_sources: Black coal (75%), photovoltaic (17%), natural gas (3%), hydropower (3%), others (2%)

QLD.energy_sources: Black coal (71%), natural gas (12%), photovoltaic (8%), oil (4%), others (5%)

SA.energy_sources: Wind power (61%), natural gas (34%), photovoltaic (4%), others (1%)

VIC.energy_sources: Natural gas (44%), brown coal (41%), wind power (8%), hydropower (3%), others (4%)

WA.energy_sources: Natural gas (65%), wind power (26%), black coal (8%), others (1%)

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete (carbonation) is a natural process not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate can replace virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
standards_and_guidance: PCR 2019:14 Construction Products and Construction Services
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks
Some environmental impact indicators have high uncertainty or limited experience
Ionising radiation indicator excludes effects from nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal underground

contact.disclaimer: This publication supersedes all previous literature on this subject. Specifications and details may change. Users must determine suitability. Holcim accepts no liability for loss or damage from use or reliance on this information.
